title: Bitcoin (BTC) Dips Below $98K, Ethereum's ETH, Cardano's ADA, Dogecoin Tumbled Over 10% in Crypto Correction - CoinDesk
summary:
Bitcoin Dips Below $96K While CoinDesk 20 Plunges 10% Amid Fed-Spurred Rout; SOL Surrenders Post-Election Rally

Date: Dec 19, 2024, Source: CoinDesk

The cryptocurrency market faced a significant downturn on December 19, with Bitcoin dropping below $96,000 amidst a wider market selloff driven by Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's comments regarding interest rates. The correction saw Bitcoin dipping 4.8% in 24 hours, with altcoins like Ethereum and Cardano also experiencing considerable losses of over 10%.

  • Bitcoin's price traded around $98,000 before falling below $96,000.
  • The CoinDesk 20 Index dropped over 10% during this period.
  • Nearly $1.2 billion in leveraged crypto derivatives positions were liquidated.
  • Traditional markets also reacted, with slight gains that eroded during trading.
  • Experts suggest this pullback may be healthy following the substantial rise in prices.
"The crypto market has already been on pins and needles around the possibility for a correction following the record run in the price of bitcoin through $100,000," said Joel Kruger, market strategist at LMAX Group.

This market correction highlights the volatility inherent in the cryptocurrency space and the influence of external economic factors, such as decisions made by the Federal Reserve.
newTitle: Bitcoin Dips Below $96K as Crypto Market Faces Major Correction

title: Ola Electric store count to touch 4,000 this Christmas; CEO Bhavish Aggarwal eyes presence in 'every town, city, tehsil' | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Ola Electric store count to touch 4,000 this Christmas; CEO Bhavish Aggarwal eyes presence in ’every town, city, tehsil’

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

Ola Electric aims to significantly increase its store presence to 4,000 by Christmas, with CEO Bhavish Aggarwal highlighting the affordability of electric vehicles.

  • Ola Electric anticipates reaching 4,000 stores by Christmas.
  • Customers can save around ₹4,000 per month by using Ola's electric vehicles.
  • New electric bike models were released on Independence Day in 2024: Roadster Pro, Roadster, and Roadster X.
  • Ola aims to integrate its own batteries into vehicles starting in the first quarter of the next financial year.
  • Ola's first electric scooter, the S1 Pro, was delivered in December 2021.
“With EVs, you will save ₹4,000 per month. Your savings will increase, and you'll save money with this savings wala scooter,” - Bhavish Aggarwal

Ola Electric’s expansion plans reflect its commitment to increasing accessibility to electric vehicles across various regions.
newTitle: Ola Electric Expands Store Count to 4,000 by Christmas

title: Bonus shares: KPI Green Energy announces January 3 as record date - CNBCTV18
summary:
KPI Green Energy Sets January 3 as Record Date for Bonus Shares

Publication Date: Latest Update Source: CNBC TV18

KPI Green Energy Ltd. has announced January 3 as the record date to determine the eligibility of shareholders for its proposed 1:2 bonus issue.

  • The bonus shares will be issued in the ratio of one equity share of ₹5 face value for every two existing shares held.
  • Subject to shareholder approval via postal ballot, the shares are expected to be dispatched by January 14, 2025.
  • The issuance will be drawn from the company's securities premium account as of March 31, 2024.
  • KPI Green has also signed a memorandum of understanding with the Rajasthan government for hybrid solar and wind power projects.
  • The company’s shares have surged 56.1% year-to-date, despite a 2.06% decline on the National Stock Exchange recently.
“The shares are expected to be dispatched within two months from the bonus issue recommendation date.”

This announcement signals positive growth for KPI Green Energy as it looks to enhance shareholder value and expand renewable energy projects in India.
newTitle: KPI Green Energy Sets January 3 as Record Date for Bonus Shares

Trade Setup for December 20: Nifty is facing its worst week in three months, can bulls turn the tide? - CNBCTV18
summary:
Trade Setup for December 20: Nifty is facing its worst week in three months, can bulls turn the tide?

Publication Date: December 20, 2023 | Source: CNBC TV18

The Nifty is experiencing its worst week in three months, facing a notable decline with a 250-point drop on Thursday. Despite the initial volatility, the index exhibited weak trading and encountered challenges in crossing key resistance levels.

  • Nifty experienced a significant drop, violating near-term support levels at 24,100 and 24,000.
  • Market participants are monitoring upcoming economic indicators, including the Bank of England policy meeting and Q3 US GDP numbers.
  • Eight IPOs are currently open for subscription, indicating a continued influx of new listings.
  • Foreign institutions were net sellers in the cash market, while domestic investors were net buyers.
  • Experts suggest potential for a relief rally but caution about weak short-term market sentiment and suggest key support levels for traders.
“For traders, the key support zones are at 23870/79000 and the 200-day SMA or 23825/78800.” - Shrikant Chouhan, Kotak Securities

The market outlook remains cautious, with analysts highlighting significant bearish momentum but also the potential for a rebound in the near term.
newTitle: Nifty Faces Challenges as Market Sees Significant Decline

Ola Electric To Open More Than 3,200 New Stores On Christmas Day

Publication Date: December 20, 2024 | Source: NDTV Profit

Ola Electric is launching over 3,200 new stores and service centers across India on December 25, significantly expanding its sales network.

  • Ola aims for a total of 4,000 stores, marking a major expansion in EV distribution.
  • Each outlet will provide after-sales support through attached service centers.
  • The rapid rollout is seen as a response to previous service issues faced by the company.
  • CEO Bhavish Aggarwal emphasized the commitment to making EVs accessible to all.
“On 25th December, we are taking India’s EV revolution to the next level.” — Bhavish Aggarwal

This expansion aligns with Ola Electric's strategy to enhance customer service and support, aiming for widespread availability of electric vehicles ahead of new product launches planned for next year.

title: Bengaluru Techie Says She's Happier After Shifting to London: "It's An Overarching Feeling" - NDTV
summary:
Bengaluru Techie Says She's Happier After Shifting to London: "It's An Overarching Feeling"

Publication Date: December 18, 2024 | Source: Sayani B's Twitter

Sayani B, a software engineer from Bengaluru, shares her positive experience of relocating to London, emphasizing her enhanced happiness despite the city's high cost of living.

  • Sayani B explained her move to London and how it has improved her overall happiness.
  • She mentioned a sense of safety on London's public transport compared to experiences in Indian cities.
  • The post sparked a discussion comparing life in India versus abroad.
  • Users commented on various aspects of living in London such as cleaner air and walkability.
"It's been a couple of months living in London, and I am in general, happier. I can't point at what exactly has been a game changer, but it's an overarching feeling 🙂" — Sayani B

Her experience highlights not only the personal benefits of relocating but also raises discussions on the quality of life in different countries.
newTitle: Bengaluru Techie Shares Happiness After Moving to London

title: Gold recovery loses steam ahead of US GDP, Jobless claims figures - FXStreet
summary:
Gold Prices Retreat Amid Positive U.S. Economic Data

Publication Date: November 13, 2023 Source: FXStreet

Gold has faced a short-lived recovery, with recent U.S. GDP and Jobless Claims data confirming strong economic performance, leading to a stronger U.S. Dollar and bearish pressure on gold prices.

  • Gold (XAU/USD) failed to rise above previous support at $2,625.
  • U.S. GDP for Q3 was reported at 3.1%, surpassing expectations.
  • Jobless claims fell to 220K, indicating a robust labor market.
  • The Federal Reserve cut rates but revised growth expectations upward.
  • The hawkish tone from Fed Chairman Jerome Powell has strengthened the U.S. Dollar.
“The central bank’s projections and an unusually hawkish tone... sent U.S. Treasury yields rallying.”

The recent U.S. economic data provides significant support to the dollar, jeopardizing gold's recovery potential.
newTitle: Gold Prices Retreat Amid Positive U.S. Economic Data

title: International Gemmological Institute IPO Listing Date: GMP Today; Share Price Prediction - ET Now
summary:
International Gemmological Institute IPO Listing Date

Date: Updated Dec 19, 2024 Source: ET NOW

The shares of International Gemmological Institute (IGI) are expected to get listed on the exchanges – NSE and BSE - on Friday, December 20.

  • Post allotment, investors are eagerly awaiting the listing of IGI shares.
  • The price band is set at Rs 397 to Rs 417, with a latest GMP of Rs 148, indicating a potential listing price of Rs 565.
  • The IPO totals Rs 4,225 crore, consisting of a fresh issue worth Rs 1,475 crore and an OFS of Rs 2,750 crore from promoter BCP Asia II TopCo Pte Ltd.

Notable Quote:

"This translates into a decent listing gain of 35.49 per cent per share."

The IPO aims to use the proceeds for acquiring IGI Belgium Group and IGI Netherlands Group, along with general corporate purposes.

Axis Capital, Kotak Mahindra Capital Company, Morgan Stanley India Company, and SBI Capital Markets are the lead managers for the IPO.

Binance co-founder calls out company for posting Indian CEO's pic with him: 'How not to use a selfie with me' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Binance co-founder warns against using selfies for promotion after 5ireChain incident

Date: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Binance co-founder Changpeng Zhao expressed concerns over the misuse of selfies for promotional purposes after an incident involving Indian blockchain company 5ireChain. The company shared a photo of Zhao with their CEO Pratik Gauri, which led to confusion about a potential collaboration.

  • 5ireChain posted a selfie of Zhao and Gauri, captioned with “What’s cooking?”.
  • Zhao clarified that they did not have a conversation and warned against using selfies for promotional material without permission.
  • The company removed the original post and issued a clarification stating it was merely an appreciation post.
This is exactly how NOT to use a selfie with me. Nothing is cooking. Didn't even have a chat. Just a selfie at an event.

This incident highlights the importance of transparency and proper context when sharing images in a professional setting.
newTitle: Binance co-founder warns against using selfies for promotion after 5ireChain incident

Axis Bank to roll out new credit card fees starting tomorrow - CNBCTV18
summary:
Axis Bank Introduces New Credit Card Fees Starting Tomorrow

Publication Date: December 19, 2024 Source: CNBCTV18

Axis Bank is introducing changes to its credit card fees, effective December 20, 2024. Customers have started receiving notifications regarding these updates, which include a new redemption fee, revised interest rates, and additional transaction charges.

  • Introduction of a ₹99 fee (plus 18% GST) for cash redemptions and ₹199 fee (plus 18% GST) for transferring points to mileage programs.
  • Applicable on several Axis Bank credit cards, excluding Citi-protege cards like Olympus and Horizon.
  • Monthly interest rates will increase to 3.75%. Payment charges for auto debit reversals and cheque returns will be 2% with a minimum of ₹500.
  • There will be a ₹100 fee for missed payments if the Minimum Amount Due is unpaid for two consecutive cycles.
  • Dynamic Currency Conversion (DCC) markup will increase to 1.5%, and various transaction fees will be implemented for education payments and spending limits.
"One of the key changes is the introduction of a redemption fee for EDGE Rewards and Miles."

This update significantly affects current and potential credit card users of Axis Bank, highlighting a trend of increasing fees in the banking sector.
newTitle: Axis Bank Introduces New Credit Card Fees Starting Tomorrow

This market crash serves as a reminder of the unpredictable nature of financial markets and the potential economic repercussions that can follow.

summary:
Air India orders 34 trainer aircraft for its upcoming flying school

Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

To enhance its aviation training capabilities, Air India has placed an order for 34 trainer aircraft, aimed at supporting its new flying school.

  • The order includes various models of trainer aircraft to provide comprehensive training.
  • This initiative is part of Air India's broader plan to boost its operational readiness.
  • The flying school will help train new pilots in high demand due to the expanding aviation market.
  • The investment demonstrates Air India's commitment to quality training and enhancing safety standards in aviation.
